allData.occupation: Senior Leader in Enterprise Technology, Educational Technology and Professional Development

positions.title: Chief Information Officer
positions.description:
Reporting to the President, the Chief Information Officer is responsible for cybersecurity, academic and administrative computing, digital networks, and telephony services. With a strong focus on customer service and commitment to quality for students, staff and the community, the Chief Information Officer provides leadership in technology implementation for campus-wide operations in a multi-campus community college setting and ensures a computing and telephone environment supporting higher education, research, and administrative services. The CIO will help plan and manage all areas of information technology including budgets, human resource supervision, strategic planning, contract administration and policy development. The CIO will drive business process analysis and improvement initiatives at the institution. 
The CIO, working in collaboration with the President, Executive Staff and the Director of Information Technology, will propose, implement, and evaluate strategic directions for campus-wide information systems. The CIO will also oversee the technological infrastructure to support academic and administrative programs of the school in the context of the college and participate in the implementation of overall strategic plans for information technology. The CIO will help present technology concerns to the collegeâ€™s administrative and academic leadership and continually refine the campus-wide technology strategy to be responsive to the needs of the school and its constituents.  
The CIO is responsible for working with a multi-campus community to improve support services for students, faculty, and staff. The CIO will also work with the Vice President of Academic Affairs to identify and promote opportunities for the use of emerging technologies to support excellence in teaching and learning, and to improve support services for students, faculty, and staff.
positions.locationName: Mt. Laurel, New Jersey, United States

positions.title: Member, Board Of Directors
positions.description:
Northeast Regional Representative, July 2014 - June 2021
Chair, Membership Committee, July 2017 - June 2021

positions.description:

administrative computing, digital networks, and telephony services.
The CIO helps plan and manage all areas of information technology including budgets, human resource supervision, strategic planning, contract administration and policy development and drives business process analysis and improvement initiatives at the institution.
The CIO is responsible for working with a multi-campus community to improve support services for
students, faculty, and staff. 
The CIO also works with the Vice President of Academic Affairs to identify and promote opportunities for the use of emerging technologies to support excellence in teaching and learning, and to improve support services for students, faculty, and staff.
positions.locationName: Mt. Laurel, New Jersey, United States

positions.title: Dean of Learning Resources
positions.description: The Dean of Learning Resources is a senior administrator whose primary responsibility is to provide leadership, strategic planning, and evaluation of all Distance Learning and Library and Information Science operations at the College.  The Dean reports to the Sr. Vice President and Provost and works closely with faculty and other Academic Deans to ensure high quality academic programs and recommends improvements aimed at program growth.  The Dean is also responsible for selecting, maintaining and operating certain components of the College's technological infrastructure.

positions.title: Associate Dean, Distance Education & Integrated Learning Resources
positions.description:
Oversee all functions, staff and budgets for Distance Education and both campus Libraries (Integrated Learning Resources)
Establish long and short-term goals for Distance and Libraries, which are consistent with the College's mission and goals
Create and implement administrative procedures related to all Library and Distance Education operations
Coordinate the expansion of on-line programs and evaluate existing programs to ensure unit goals and objectives are met
Provide professional development opportunities related to technology, distance education and information literacy
Recommend new courses or programs and develop strategies for increased enrollment, evaluate programs and services
Assist in the development of operating and teaching standards to promote and evaluate quality instruction and services
Consult with other administrators to ensure integration of departmental functions into the overall objectives of the College
Serve as System Administrator for multiple Learning Management Systems (WebCT and Blackboard Learn)
Participate in training activities which broaden awareness of innovative instructional methods and specialized equipment
Utilize computer applications such as spreadsheets, word processing, calendaring, email, database and ERP software
Compile statistics to accurately assess and evaluate progress and to document academic and institutional assessment efforts

honors.title: Educational Technology Trailblazer Award
honors.description: The Educational Technology Trailblazer award is given annually to a person, group, or organization that has significantly improved the education of others through the innovative use of technology.

volunteerExperiences.description: "Cub Scout den leaders work directly with Cub Scouts and their parents/guardians to execute the Cub Scouting program in the den." - http://www.scouting.org/scoutsource/CubScouts/Leaders/About/ThePack/csden.aspx
Provide religious education to 6th grade students.
Assisted in the writing, editing, preparation and submission of Phase I and Phase II New Jersey Charter School applications.  Served as the "Qualified Founder" on the founding team.

allData.headline: Senior Leader in Enterprise Technology, Educational Technology and Professional Development
allData.summary:
Dr. Martin A. Hoffman, Sr. has been fascinated by educational technology since the days of 35mm filmstrips and 16mm movie projectors and has pursued this love by working at museums, libraries, and schools.  For the past three decades, he has been an administrator in postsecondary education. He is currently the CIO for Rowan College at Burlington County in New Jersey where he directs all IT, A/V, Distance Education and Library services.  He is also a Senior Adjunct faculty member at the College and has taught online, hybrid and classroom courses in Computer Science, Physics, and Health Information Technology.  Martin is a past-Chair of the New Jersey Community College Distance Education Affinity Group, the former Executive Director of the Consortium for Distance Education a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation dedicated to the advancement of distance education and is the Chair of the Board of Directors of the Instructional Technology Council, an international educational technology leadership and professional development organization.  He sits on the American Association of Community Colleges' Commission on Institutional Infrastructure and Transformation.  Martin also serves as a peer reviewer for the Quality Matters program and the Middle States Commission on Higher Education.   Martin earned his doctorate in Educational Technology Leadership from New Jersey City University.

Specialties: 
Blackboard Senior Certified Trainer
Certified Professional Web Designer Associate
Cisco Certified Academy Instructor for Web Design
Quality Mattersâ„¢ Peer Reviewer
MSCHE Peer Reviewer
Not-for-Profit Organization Leadership
